page.title: 10ARKWRIGHT HOUSE,PRESTON
page.content: Arkwright House was built in 1728 in Stoneygate, Preston. It is the oldest house in Preston and it belonged to the headmaster of the old Grammar School. In 1768 Richard Arkwright rented a room there and invented and built the Water Frame. In 1840 it became a public house called the Arkwright Arms. In 1890 it was bought by the Temperance movement and became a lodging house for homeless people. From 1950 to 1978 it was derelict. Restored by 1980, it was opened by H.R.H. Princess Alexandra. It is now used by W.R. Tuson College as an adult education centre. They do English as a second language, Art and Design courses, and 'A' and 'O' level exams.
